citation.article-title: Proposal of the genus Thermoactinomyces sensu stricto and three new genera, Laceyella, Thermoflavimicrobium and Seinonella, on the basis of phenotypic, phylogenetic and chemotaxonomic analyses
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Thermoflavimicrobium (Ther′mo.fla.vi.mi.cro′bi.um. Gr. adj. thermos hot; L. adj. flavus yellow; Gr. adj. mikros small; Gr. n. bios life; N.L. neut. n. Thermoflavimicrobium a thermophilic yellow-coloured microbe).
Cells are aerobic, Gram-positive, non-acid-fast and chemo-organotrophic.
Aerial and substrate mycelia are formed.
Aerial mycelium is yellow and abundant.
Sessile endospores are produced on dichotomously branched sporophores.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan contains meso-DAP but no characteristic sugars.
Additional characters found in this study are as follows.
Major fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, anteiso-C15 : 0 and iso-C16 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain of the type species is 43 mol% (determined by HPLC in this study).
The type species is Thermoflavimicrobium dichotomicum (Cross and Goodfellow 1973).
